reviews.text: I went to Los Angeles for a work-related conference, which was held at the convention center. I am not a big fan of the neighborhood around the LA convention center because there's really a lack of a neighborhood feel around it. Also, there is a lack of reasonable food options around the convention center.
reviews.title: Great Location
Some Good, Some Not-So-Good
reviews.text: Instead of staying too far from the convention center, we decided to stay in Little Tokyo, which is relatively close to the convention center. Being a big fan of Japanese food and culture, it was a perfect solution to our problem.

The hotel itself, however, was not as nice as I hoped. Basically, we got what we paid for. Our room was clean and relatively functional, but was very small. No special amenities. The doornob, I think, was in need of repair. However, free internet access was great. We had a great government rate deal (I workk for a public benefit corporation for the state of New York) which included a room, free internet, free "continental" breakfast, and a visit to their spa.
reviews.title: should be a 1 star

reviews.text: However, by no means we felt "unsafe." In terms of safety, I would feel much less safe around the convention center.
reviews.title: Good for going cheap and 10x better than Motel6

likes.liked: — Location was safe in a safe area, lots of cheap Japanese restaurants nearby.
likes.disliked: — Wi-fi didn't reach to the upper floor rooms.

reviews.text: If this hotel was located in a boring neighborhood, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. However, for those who will be going to LA for a convention, I highly recommend staying at Miyako instead of any of the typical "convention hotels." The hotel is centrally located in Little Tokyo, more centrally so than other hotels. We found too many wonderful places to shop and eat around the hotel than any other hotel we have ever stayed in our travels.
reviews.title: Tries to punch above its weight - not a 3*

likes.liked: — Free overnight parking on the street outside
likes.disliked: — Spartan dated decoration of the room

reviews.text: The front desk people are not very friendly, the tour desk lady was extremely unfriedly - no smile, no greeting and makes you feel like you are the rude one. Maybe it is just me, thinking that most Japanese are friendly.
reviews.title: Average Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was big, the toilet is quite big, but the room looks old.....the power switches are at odd places, very high on the wall (had to use a chair) or very low near the entrance.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our flight wasnt till 11pm, so we pay extra to stay till 6pm. Our room pass didn't work when we try to use it at 4pm. Had to go to the front desk to get it 're-programmed'. The front desk didn't even say anything, only - it should work now.
reviews.title: Unique, modern, taste of Japan

reviews.text: I dont know if I will recommend this hotel to others...
reviews.title: Excellent Overall.
Great for the price!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights for our Los Angeles trip. We were pleasantly suprised.
Me and one of my best friends stayed at this hotel during our 5 nights in L.A.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel in a safe area in L.A

reviews.text: Hotel was quiet clean and the staff were very helpful with directions and tips, it is located in a very safe area in Down town L.A ( 2 blocks from LAPD). Downtown L.A in my opinon isnt a safe city at all therefore i was happy to stay in this hotel which was full of nice japanese resturants and people and atmosphere just around.
reviews.title: overlooking little tokyo restaurants

reviews.text: You need a car to get around L.A( hollywood , beverly hills, bel air) as the metro system is not well conected in this city also it is not recommended at night. there is a metro stop 5 min walk from the hotel .
reviews.title: Great location for japantown and downtown...bit of a drive from main sights

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in L.A with a car .
reviews.title: Hollywood trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very reasonable value, esp compared with Kyoto (old New Otani) 2 blocks away; hotel has very little public space, but renovated room in top floor was spacious, well furnished. Very convenient location, a 100 step stroll away from all the little Tokyo restaurants and shops. Rooms in Kyoto, by contrast, were much more dated/worn, although much nicer public spaces including roof garden and restaurants in latter.
reviews.title: Great hotel, beautiful rooms
Significantly overrated
reviews.text: The Miyako was okay but nothing more, and not nearly as nice as the Westin Bonaventure, where I have stayed on previous trips to the downtown area of LA. Staff at the Miyako was very friendly and helpful, and it had free internet in the rooms, a definite plus. But the internet was spotty -- very slow a lot of the time. I was upgraded to an "executive" room on the 10th floor, but it was dark (not enough lighting) and had a tired feel to it. Getting a little shabby around the edges. TV was old and only got about 20 channels, with no options for movies, games, etc. Bathroom was mediocre -- the showerhead was crappy. I also found the hotel a bit too noisy -- there was a lot of mechanical noise, squealing elevators and things like that, even though I was far from the elevator. Valet parking with unlimited in and out was about $22 per night, including all taxes. The hotel fitness center was small and is part of the spa, so you have to pay extra to use it (ripoff, in this day and age). The area, Little Tokyo, has a lot of homeless people and is quite small (basically about 2 square blocks, so it's good for a couple of hours at most of looking around, but really is pretty uninspiring.
I wouldn't stay here again. For about the same price, the Westin is better all around.
reviews.title: Close to station

reviews.text: Stayed there for 2 nights. Close to Union station - used subway to Universal Studio and Flyaway bus to LAX. The room was dated but clean. The hotel was surrounded by Japanese restaurants which was good for Japanese food lovers. A good located hotel if you rely on public transport.
reviews.title: i love this little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: do yourself a favor and visit the spa - get a shiatsu massage. - very affordable for the quality of service - dont worry you can thank me later. also: get a green tea smoothie from the cafe on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Good value but don't expect luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: As other travelers have mentioned, the hotel needs updating. Our room was pretty decent for the price we paid, clean. Bathroom / room were a decent size. The sink wasn't draining very well though and the toilet got kinda "stuck" a couple of times and kept running for longer than normal. Lobby area was nice, staff was very helpful and front desk always answered all the questions. They have maps of surrounding area which includes restaurants etc. Overall, the location is great - you can easily walk to Chinatown and all over downtown. And the area is safe.
reviews.title: Nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won a bid for this hotel thru Priceline for $75/night.
reviews.title: Clean Place, Friendly Staff
Nice place to stay. friendly and clean.
reviews.text: Most sites rate this hotel 3-star, Tripadvisor rate this 2-star.

reviews.title: Very Unfriendly Experience
reviews.text: Hotel exterior looks old, but once you step in, it's a different story. The lobby is bright and clean and spacious.
Parking was ~$20 per 24-hour. Its valet.
reviews.title: Fantastic Room Facilities, Economic Stay!

likes.liked: — cheap rates but with 5 star room facilities
likes.disliked: — lack of public transportation close by

reviews.text: I had a good experience, because they upgraded us to "Tokyo Executive Room". What a surprise even I booked this thru Priceline. Apparently, there were two groups of tour (from Japan I guess) checked in before us (We checked in really late night), thus all standard/deluxe rooms had been taken, we got an upgrade.
reviews.title: Bargain with a great neighborhood feel
awsome
reviews.text: service was excellent, great location, near everything. i thought it was a clean enviroment, from indoor to outdoor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during out 3 day trip to Los Angeles and we were very positively surprised. Considering the price paid for our room, and based on our previous experience with US hotels, we haven't expected much. But the Miyako is not like other hotels. Although it is rated as a 3 stars hotel, it can easily hold pace with a lot of 4 stars hotels in an upper price category. The room was very clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. All in all we got very good quality for our moneyand we will book the hotel again during our trip to LA.
reviews.title: Very good hotel Downtown

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay, found it a really exceptional value, will go back. The hallways were a little dingy w/ low ceilings, but that would be my biggest complaint; where it counted, the Miyako delivered nicely: good service, nice room, clean, great bed. We sprung for the deluxe room, glad I did. Cute Japanese/modern design (a refreshing break from the generic, mediocre, cookie-cutter aesthetic of most mid-priced hotels), super comfy duvet, fun location, w/tons of Japanese restaurants and shops at your doorstep--more fun than staying elsewhere in downtown LA. We have stayed in the Omni many times in the past, and although this ain't it, for the money saved (like upwards of $200 a night), I was very happy with the Miyako.
reviews.title: Exceptional value, fun Japantown location, cool modern/Japanese design with character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our son is moving to LA for school so he and my husband stayed here over a weekend to find him an apartment near USC. They enjoyed their stay. We moved our son our to LA the following weekend and we stayed here again over a Saturday night. They are right across the street from the Little Tokyo Plaza. Great places to eat there and some really nice dessert shops. Since the hotel is downtown and we stayed here over a Saturday night, it was pretty quiet. My husband and I got up Sunday morning and walked around downtown. Pretty quiet with mostly people waiting for the buses.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay downtown, it is a really nice hotel. The room we had was great and very comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: The perfect location for eating and shopping Japanese style.

reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by the hotel - ideal for downtown, and despite the other reviews, we felt very safe in the area.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: We did use the valet parking option at $16 per night.
reviews.title: Ridiculous Parking and not safe location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were basic and fine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the money in spite of the location

reviews.text: Breakfast was included with the AAA rate, which was not great and we did not have it everyday - it was served at a sort of cafe in the lobby.
reviews.title: Not fancy, but clean and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel all the time and this was the worst experience I have had regarding service. The hotel itself is nice and cute with good rooms. My problem is the location........freaking scary. The only "safe" area is standing in front of the hotel and the few restaurants across the street. If you walk around the block it is covered with homeless people and not safe at all. Also the parking is a freaking joke. If you don't get your tickets validated every time, you can't leave the garage. I asked if they can call the hotel and verify my room, they said no. I even had a sheet that the hotel asked me to fill out stating I was paying the daily rate of $14 and she the parking attendent said no. I had to go back to my room, go down to the lobby, get my ticket validated then get out of the garage. By the way, the garage is NOT connected, you have to walk in a narrow corridor to get to it through a dark passageway. Are you kidding me????? I will never ever stay here again. I even spoke to the manager about it, and they said that's just how it is. I should be able to put a flyer on my vehicle to show that I piad for parking and just have the attendent open the gate, just like many other hotels do.
reviews.title: Heart of Little Tokyo-Close to Amtrak Station

likes.liked: — The bed linens on the bed!
likes.disliked: — Not as clean as I would have liked and somewhat of a language barier

reviews.text: In town for business,booked for 3 nights close to my! meeting,rooms are ok!but if you want to get a goodnite of sleep avoid this place because on 3rd floor there is a karoke bar/OJAH BAR thats open allnite,you hear the loud noise allover the hotel,i spoke to the gm he told me that's how it is!very rude!so i checked after i nite!
reviews.title: No sleep hotel!

likes.disliked: — LOUD NOISE COMING FROM THE BAR!!

reviews.title: Not bad for lone female traveller.
reviews.text: This hotel was not bad for the money. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I was a young female staying alone for business and I didn't feel unsafe. The worst thing was the rooms were not very well lit and upon entering the lobby it smelled horribbly like fish. However, the rooms did not smell. The staff was quite friendly but there was a bit of a language barrier. They had many papmplets available at the desk for tourist attractions in the area. Free parkng and close to major freeways. Overall, I would stay in the hotel again. The other hotels in the area were much more expensive in comparision.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in downtown LA, it is good value for the money. For the tourists who don't have a car, the subway is 2 blocks away (12 minutes' walk) and takes you directly to Hollywood and Universal Studios, where all the tourist attractions are.
reviews.title: Great place to stay at a good price

reviews.text: For tall people (over 6 foot or 180cm), the bed may be too small. Otherwise, it is a great place to stay. Clean and tidy. Much better than motels, and just a bit less than the Hilton. Will definately stay there again. And if you need an internet connection for working, take the rooms with DSL, they are worth it!
reviews.title: Japanese Elegance at the Miyako

reviews.text: What an incredible find. Located in LA's Little Tokyo, the Miyako is an oasis with elegantly appointed rooms done in simple Japanese decor. The rooms were good sized and the bathrooms were large with high-tech toilets that do everything but...... Just think toilet/bidet and massage in one. Even though it's downtown, the neighborhood seemed very nice and friendly, even at midnight. There's a dozen Japanese restaurants right across the street and a small inner city mall nearby. The staff was at the least, prompt and efficient and at best, very friendly. My only caveat would be the plasma screen TVs. You say plasma screen and you think high end. But I've noticed at many hotels with plasma TVs that the screens just aren't very good: blurry, poor resolution and pixelation. But it certainly makes a good impression when you walk in the room. I usually stay in West Hollywood, but on a budget. The price, $115, with free broadband and convenience of the Miyako will be hard to beat.
reviews.title: If you're in that area, it's THE place
